ResourceHeader.ResourceName: TIMED GUVI Level 1C FUV Airglow Fluxes
ResourceHeader.Description: This level 1C data set from the Global Ultraviolet Imager (GUVI) instrument on board the Thermosphere Ionosphere Mesosphere Energetics and Dynamics (TIMED) mission contains far-ultraviolet (FUV) airglow in calibrated, geolocated (at a 150-km altitude), and rectified intensities (gridded and binned to a 25 km x 25 km resolution) for the 5 wavelengths bands: HI(121.6nm), OI(130.4nm), OI(135.6nm), LBHS(141-152.8nm), and LBHL(167.2-181.2nm), providing a ground swath of 3000 km width in a nearly contiguous global coverage every day. There are 5 display options: (1) Mapped images of the (lin or log) intensities by orbit using a transverse Mercator projection. (2) Mapped images of the (lin or log) intensities using a polar projection of the North and South pole areas. Generating thumbnails for (1) or (2) for one day takes about 1 minute. (3) Movies of plot types (1),(2): There are 15 orbits/frames per day, max is 2 days, i.e. 30 frames. (4) Images of intensities as scanned along the orbit. (5) Line plots of intensities at selected across-track positions.
